title: Morgantown Campus Quarantine Cases by Day
description: Quarantine means avoiding contact with others to the furthest extent possible for 14 days, as directed by the local health department. Persons who are quarantining should not be on campus for class or work at any point during this period. Persons are likely in quarantine because they’ve been considered a close contact of someone who tested positive for COVID-19. The University has been aggressive in quarantining as we know students live near one another, and in an abundance of caution we have quarantined to mitigate community spread.
